p: Deforestation is a result of the development of intensive monocultures and the extension of urbanization, which leads to a decreased vegetation cover across the planet. The reduction of wild areas is a factor often cited by experts as a leading factor for the emergence of diseases, the fragmentation of forests directly affects the natural biodiversity; likewise, the destruction of predators unbalances the food chain in favor of certain vectors carrying certain transmissible agents ( Walsh et al., 1993, Gottwalt, 2013).
